title: StatsInfo elapsed time is now globally-scoped

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

The elapsed time returned by `StatsInfo.RemoteStats()` is based on the application lifetime via `startTime` package var.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

current master

In previous releases (at least as of 1.52) the elapsed time calculated by `StatsInfo` was based on details of the transfers overseen by that instance of the type.  In current master and 1.55, a package-scoped `startTime` var was introduced and is initialized at package init, and all elapsed times are computed since this time.  For applications that embed rclone as a library and may perform multiple transfers over the application lifetime, this value isn't relevant.  I know that library embedding isn't necessarily one of rclone's design goals, but with all the recent de-globalization of the config and filter system, this feels like a regression towards globalism.

One possible solution would be to make `startTime` scoped to a particular `StatsInfo` object, initialized at construction, and then reset along with the other counters when `StatsInfo.ResetCounters` is called.  I'm happy to file a PR with a patch that improves this if someone on the rclone team could provide a bit of guidance!
